title.narrative: OUTPUT 21: JUSTICE FOR CHILDREN SERVICES

description.narrative: By 2022, capacities of formal and informal service providers enhanced to provide equitable, quality and coordinated child-friendly justice services, to girls and boys and their families, which contributes to Promotion Of Care, Mental Health And Psychosocial Well-Being And Justice. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2022, girls and boys in Ghana, especially the most disadvantaged, increasingly benefit from an equitable and integrated child protection system.

mailing-address.narrative: 4-8 Rangoon Close Ward 24 P.O. Box 5051 Cantoments Accra

sector.narrative: Access to child-friendly and gender-responsive justice processes and procedures

Technical assistance - Legal identity (including birth registration/civil registration and vital statistics systems)

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2022, capacities of formal and informal service providers enhanced to provide equitable, quality and coordinated child-friendlyjustice services, to girls and boys and their families

description.narrative: UNICEF supported the Government of Ghana to make the criminal justice system;more child-friendly and gender-responsive, benefitting approximately 2943 children (girls 2670, boys 273);with most of these children had suffered from sexual violence. These children were reached through a total of 10 new child-friendly courts, a child-protection digital forensic laboratory to fight online child sexual exploitation and abuse, and training of 2029 criminal justice system personnel.;The Domestic Violence and Victim Support Unit successfully completed its five-year strategic plan with support from UNICEF.; | Status:On-track | As-of Date:31/12/2021
